Cost: Building a robot can be expensive, and there may be difficulties in finding the necessary resources to create a robot that meets the desired specifications.
Safety concerns: Robots can be dangerous, and there may be concerns about the safety of the robot and those around it. This could include concerns about the robot's ability to cause harm or injuries.
Ethical concerns: Robots are capable of performing tasks that were previously done by humans, which raises ethical concerns about the impact of robots on the job market and society as a whole.
Limited mobility: Robots may have limited mobility, which could make it difficult for them to navigate certain environments or perform certain tasks.
Maintenance and repair: Robots require maintenance and repair, which can be time-consuming and expensive. There may also be difficulties in finding qualified technicians to repair the robot.
